Sriwijaya Air Batalkan Penerbangan, Penumpang Menumpuk di Bandara
07 Nov 2019, 08:28 by Antara, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Belasan penerbangan Sriwijaya Air tertanggal 7 November 2019 di Bandara Soekarno-Hatta Tangerang Banten dibatalkan dan ditunda sehingga ratusan penumpang terlantar.
Salah seorang petugas Bandara Soekarno-Hatta di Gerbang D2 Terminal 2 Bandara yang tidak menyebutkan namanya, mengatakan bahwa pembatalan penerbangan dikarenakan ketiadaan pesawat.
Rini Suryati, salah seorang penumpang Pesawat Sriwijaya Air dengan kode penerbangan SJ 248 tujuan Malang mengaku kecewa berat karena pembatalan penerbangan tersebut. "Kecewa berat. Saya sudah turun kereta, lanjut taksi, sampai sini malah dibatalkan," kata Rini.
Penumpang menumpuk di ruang tunggu Bandara Soekarno-Hatta meminta kejelasan pada petugas Sriwijaya Air dan sebagian memilih beralih ke penerbangan lain.
Sebelumnya Direktur Teknik dan Layanan Garuda Iwan Joeniarto dalam keterangannya yang beredar di Jakarta, Kamis, 7 November 2019 menginformasikan bahwa Sriwijaya Air tidak lagi tergabung dengan Garuda Indonesia Group yang sebelumnya telah menjalin kerja sama operasi.
“Kami merujuk pada status terkini kerja sama manajemen antara Sriwijaya dan Citilink, anak usaha Garuda Indonesia. Karena ada sejumlah masalah di mana kedua pihak belum bisa diselesaikan. Dengan berat hati, kami menginformasikan bahwa Sriwijaya melanjutkan bisnisnya sendiri,” kata Iwan Joeniarto.
Dengan demikian, Sriwijaya Air tidak lagi menjadi anggota Garuda Indonesia Group dan hubungan dengan Sriwijaya Group akan kembali berdasarkan business to business (B to B).
Sebelumnya, Garuda Indonesia Group dan Sriwijaya Air Group menjalin kerja sama operasi seiring dengan kondisi keuangan perusahaan maskapai nasional swasta itu yang tidak mendukung.
Meski tak ada penerbangan, Branch Communication Manager Bandara Soekarno-Hatta, Haerul Anwar memastikan bahwa maskapai Sriwijaya Air masih beroperasi di Bandara Soetta. "Kami cek ke OIC dan Sriwijaya masih beroperasi sesuai jadwal," katanya kepada Tempo di Tangerang, Kamis 7 November 2019.
Terkait dengan video ratusan penumpang Sriwijaya Air yang protes karena terlantar di Terminal 2F sampai siang ini, Haerul menjelaskan bahwa hal tersebut terjadi karena masalah ketidakpastian jadwal penerbangan, bukan karena Sriwijaya Air sudah tidak beroperasi di Bandara Soekarno Hatta. "Belum begitu didalami penyebabnya, tapi karena ketidakjelasan waktu terbang," kata Haerul.

Sriwijaya Air Cancels Flights, Passengers Pile up at the Airport
Nov 7 2019, 08:28 by Antara, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Dozens of Sriwijaya Air flights dated November 7, 2019 at Soekarno-Hatta Airport, Tangerang, Banten were canceled and delayed so that hundreds of passengers were displaced.
One Soekarno-Hatta Airport official at Gate D2 Terminal 2, who did not give his name, said that the flight was canceled due to the absence of the aircraft.
Rini Suryati, a passenger of Sriwijaya Air flight with flight code SJ 248 to Malang, admitted that she was disappointed because of the flight cancellation. "I am very disappointed. I have already gotten off the train, the taxi continued, until here it was canceled," said Rini.
Passengers piled up in the waiting room of the Soekarno-Hatta Airport asking for clarification from Sriwijaya Air officers and some chose to switch to another flight.
Earlier, Garuda's Technical and Service Director Iwan Joeniarto in his statement circulating in Jakarta on Thursday, November 7, 2019 informed that Sriwijaya Air was no longer affiliated with the Garuda Indonesia Group which had previously established joint operations.
"We refer to the current status of management cooperation between Sriwijaya and Citilink, a subsidiary of Garuda Indonesia. Because there are a number of problems where the two parties cannot be resolved. With a heavy heart, we inform that Sriwijaya continues its own business, "said Iwan Joeniarto.
Thus, Sriwijaya Air is no longer a member of the Garuda Indonesia Group and relations with Sriwijaya Group will return based on business to business (B to B).
Previously, Garuda Indonesia Group and Sriwijaya Air Group established joint operations in line with the financial condition of the private national airline company that did not support it.
Although there were no flights, the Branch Communication Manager of Soekarno-Hatta Airport, Haerul Anwar confirmed that the Sriwijaya Air airline was still operating at Soetta Airport. "We checked with OIC and Sriwijaya was still operating according to schedule," he told Tempo in Tangerang, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
Regarding the video of hundreds of Sriwijaya Air passengers protesting because they were displaced at Terminal 2F until this afternoon, Haerul explained that this happened because of uncertainty about flight schedules, not because Sriwijaya Air was no longer operating at Soekarno Hatta Airport. "The causes have not been explored so much, but because of the lack of clarity when flying," said Haerul.
